subtitle: What’s the fuss all about?
title: Climaxing and orgasm
content:
An orgasm is a physical reaction your body can have from sexual stimulation on your private parts. It is a gentle contraction of the muscles around your sex organs that feels great!

**How can I have an orgasm?** 
When you touch or rub your vagina in a way that feels pleasurable, this is called masturbating. It can give you an orgasm (which is also called ‘coming’). It’s safe and normal to masturbate but it should always be done alone and in private. Masturbating is a good way for you to understand how your vagina works and to teach yourself how to have an orgasm. It is normal to think of all sorts of sexy things while you are masturbating. These are called fantasies. You can also have an orgasm when you have sex. 

**Why is it called climaxing or ‘coming’?** 
When you masturbate, the friction of rubbing your genitals will make you feel like you are getting closer and closer, climbing to the top of a rollercoaster. When you hit the peak of your sexual excitement (climax) your muscles will contract and the feeling will spread. 

**How will I know if I’ve had an orgasm?** 
Most people agree that it’s a very nice feeling – like waves of pleasure going through your whole body. It is not something that sneaks up on you, generally you have to masturbate for a while to get there so you’ll definitely know once you’ve had an orgasm! 

**Masturbation is a safe way to learn about your own body and what feels good. It’s always up to you to decide who else touches your genitals, but you should always feel safe and**
